Definition: A private space for each individual user. To set up an account, a username, password, and/or email are required. Can also refer to an email account.
Can be set to "Active" or "Deactivated"
For posts, a feature that asks readers to state that they have read the post a response button and function.

Allows users to acknowledge that this post has been read. Typically, the acknowledgment feature is used for mandatory information that needs to be acknowledged by the user that it was read. For example, security-relevant information.
[posts] column header - Indicates additional options, such as Edit and Delte;" also used as a tooltip for an elipses (...) in a cloumn that indicates more options.
To put an option, mechanism (toggle, etc.) or system into action. Can also be used with a variety for other terms, like "users", "access, "permissions", "settings", and so forth.
Comment: We don't use enable anymore to avoid ableist language.

Definition: Use activation when a change immediately takes effect. If you are giving someone the possibility to do something (such as turning on the ability for users to delete their chat messages), use enable/disable instead.
[Dashboard and analytics] An active user is a user that has accessed the App at least once during a selected date range. See "engaged user.
Activity of certain spaces or users

"Add" should be used when the user can put something that already exists in a new place. For example, they have the URL for an app and they add it to the platform. "Create" should be used when users must write or enter something new, that they don't select from or don't already have.
"Add is preferred as it is shorter and simpler. Add is done on an individual basis, so a widget is added to a page, but a widget is installed to the platform, where it is then available on other content types.
[problem: often used where ""create"" is more appropriate]"
[not sure if this tem is actually in use; Term List shows as preferred] the portal that admins, editors and so on use to configure, add or manage something in the platform
when talking about Staffbase user roles, use the full word "administrator"; "admin" is acceptable if space is limited
Short for "Artificial Intelligence" and "Künstliche Intelligenz" respectivly.
Grant permissions or ability. Note that a good alternative is "you can" - Example: "This new app allows you to see metrics..." -> "With the new app, you can see metrics..."
[nav tab label] Studio Overview of the tool for measuring engagement and content success.
[do we use only "analytics"?] [TL] component to track special data for the analytics tool

Do not use without approval from the legal team and talking with developers. Only use anonymous if data can never be traced back to the user. For most of our features, we’ll use “confidential” instead of anonymous.

Use to refer to mobile apps only. Don't use "web app" since this is not a commonly used term for the average person. Also, app and/or intranet. Use: How Users will view ... in the App ; employee app; mobile users

With the app lock, the app can only be opened if the mobile device is secured with a code. The app lock is activated company-wide by your Customer Success Manager. Users can unlock text each day on a quiz calendar. Also used in email.
For applying filter options.
Action button label used in File Manager and Content Designer for inserting a link.
[Action label] Used with Comments; can be used in other instances for granting permissions.
Text, images, and other media (see "post")
For post appointed to a campaign for instance. See 'assignment' as well.
For appointing users to groups for instance.
For tokens that are 'assigned' to certain content.

Used with campaigns. User can assign an existing post to a campaign. Also used with members to mandatory and conditional groups. Channels are also assigned to news pages. Contributors can be assigned to Journeys.
Users who will see a scheduled post or content. Can be public or private/targeted to specific users.
Button for voice calling a person from their profile page.
The process of verifying who a user is. Ensures the identity of a user who requests access.
See "contributor"
The process of verifying what users have access to. Ensures that the user who requests the access is eligible to access the info.
The authorization token from the user's Twilio account.
Only use when technically required, like for OAuth permissions, use “authorize.” Otherwise, use “let.”
Only use when technically required, like for OAuth permissions, use “authorize.” Otherwise, use “let.”
The circular icon containing a user's initials, profile image or status.
button label: returns user to previous screen. Do not use to replace "Cancel"
Reusable pieces of content used in editors
You can also set a publishing freeze for the timeframe. The publishing freeze will suggest that editors consider rescheduling their posts, both in the editorial calendar and the Studio news editor.
The colors of a company's brand used for branding the app accordingly
Program to allow people to view and browse web pages. When accessing Staffbase’s web app from mobile, refer to the ‘mobile browser’ not the app.
Clickable page component.
Different features for planning content or creating scheduled quizzes.
The Calendars plugin allows you to create one or more calendars for your users directly within the app.
Feature that allows strategic planning, creation, mangement, and analysis of content.
Use to negate the primary action. It is okay to use other terms if it better explains the negative action.
Record of user account activities.

A channel is like a news segment in a newspaper or, in this case, the news page. Channels allow very fine, granular visibility settings as to who is allowed to see the posts within a specific channel in the app. 
See "post/news post", as channels allow for specific types of posts. They're based on both theme and post-type.
For different graphical depictions of data in analytics
The alternative point of contact listed for customers after "Staffbase Support" in support articles
The menu that opens when a user clicks their avatar in the standalone Employee Email web app
The address bar of a browser.
The way an Employee Email add-in or extension tracks unique vs. repeat opens and clicks
E.g., when a notifcation informs the user about something.
Numbers and letters in a CSV file or data table

An integration enriches or extends the functionalities within the Staffbase platform. This is done by either extending the functionalities in your employee app or intranet, or in the Studio. For example: linking or embedding external content, embedding login-protected external content, synchronizing content to and from an external source, making external applications or processes available within your employee app or intranet automating user lifecycle management"
The UI of our app.
The tab of the Email Stats Page where you can segment engagement data for an individual sent email
Opened tabs inside a browser window
Distribution lists uploaded via CSV or customized with the Employee Email web app
Distribution lists containing a set of contacts that changes automatically over time based on their attributes.
Customizable and reusable rough copies of an email.
Files created and saved using the Email Designer that have not been sent out as emails yet

Staffbase offers data centers in different countries to host your platform and data. In the Studio, you can check where your platform is hosted and your platform's base URL that you need to use for API authentication.
Refers to the place of a data center where a costumers platform and data is stored.
people who use Staffbase on iOS and Android devices
In studio, refers to top nav bar. In mobile, to quicklings bar at the buttom.

A news page is like a newspaper or a social network, where new content is regularly published. The latest posts are always displayed at the top, which is why older posts gradually disappear from the newsfeed and the user’s radar. This means that the content has a short to medium lifespan.
A profile picture makes a user profile more personal and helps new employees find their way around faster.
Metric used to track how long an email is held open by recipients.
The setting available when Shared views are enabled, allowing members of the same Group to either share or not share their Email Drafts by default
The setting available when Shared views are enabled, allowing members of the same Group to either share or not share their sent emails by default
The setting that allows members of the same Group to automatically share their sent emails and/or their Email Drafts by default
The main menu of the mobile ios app
You can add a blocker within the editorial calendar to include important company plans or communications. Blockers are visible to all editors.
For refering to the log in to different accounts like for employees, Google, SSO, etc.
For refering to the log in to different accounts like for employees, Google, SSO, etc.
For refering to the log out to different accounts like for employees, Google, SSO, etc.
For refering to the log out to different accounts like for employees, Google, SSO, etc.
Percentage of total Opens where Read Time = 3-8 seconds (inclusive)
Distribution lists containing a set of contacts that doesn't change.

The Directory plugin allows you to create a directory of all active and pending users in your employee app. Using the Directory plugin, employees can access coworker's contact details, such as their phone number, email, or company role, if filled out in the user profile. In addition, users can also see a list of the most recent comments by the respective coworker.
The Chat plugin allows private one-on-one or group messaging within the app.

Surveys make it easy for users to engage and helps you gain valuable user insights on a regular basis. You can choose between a regularly scheduled survey rhythm, which allows you to gather insights on one topic over time, or a one-time survey.

With the Forms plugin, you can create customized forms for users to fill out and submit via the employee app. You can customize the contents, input types, and required fields to create a form that fits your needs perfectly.

The Quiz Calendar is a fun way for your company to engage users leading up to significant company events, milestones, or the holidays. You can set up custom quiz questions, images, or text that your users can unlock each day of the calendar.

The Links plugin allows you to link to another website and place this link on the menu of your app. The Links plugin creates a bridge between your employee app and an external website, such as your company homepage. Opening a target-link using the Links plugin will navigate the user away from the employee app. For mobile users, the link opens in the mobile browser and for desktop users, it opens in a new tab.

An embedded page is a link to an external website that opens within your employee app. The link to an embedded page displays as an item in the app menu. When users click on the menu item, the external page will load within the app, as would a normal app page.
Journeys allows you to guide employees on their individual journey at your organization. Create customized content and set an individual timeline to support employees with their new tasks.

The Calendars plugin allows you to create one or more calendars for your users directly within the app. These customizable calendars are a great way to keep employees up to date with company activities and important events. With the Calendars plugin, you can create not only company-wide calendars but also user-specific calendars, which support organization and collaboration within and across departments.

The Event Registration plugin allows you to create and manage detailed event registration pages. Add all the important details of an event to your event registration, such as time, date, and place, as well as a thorough description and capacity limit. Users will can see an overview of company events, register for events, and view upcoming and past events directly in the app.

The Maps plugin allows you to show your users specific locations on a map. The location appears as a pinpoint on the map. You can add a name and detailed description to each location. This enables you to give users access to important data even on the go, such as office, delivery, or store locations.
The Integrated Content plugin allows you to embed content more flexibly into your app and view external websites, while keeping the same look and feel of your app or intranet.

The Facebook Pages plugin allows you to embed a Facebook page in your employee app. This gives you the means to include employees who do not actively use Facebook in the company’s public-facing communications. Users open the embedded Facebook page by clicking on a menu point in the employee app, allowing users to browse the linked Facebook feed without leaving the app.

To add any type of static content, in the same design and visual style as that of other widgets, use the Static Content widget. In this way, the content in the static content also has the same layout style options as the other widgets. You can experiment with background colors of this widget or simply choose the branding color of your app.

To add contact information outside the employee directory, use the User Profile widget. This is useful if you want to show a contact, for example, on the Contact Us page. If the user profile contains details, such as location, department, job title, and so on, those are displayed.

To add a selection of files, use the File List widget. Users can open or download these files. For example, if you have a page on Corporate Social Responsibility, place all related files, such as guidelines, activities planned for the year, and so on, on the file list.
To add a box to call attention to particular information, warning, or a tip to your pages, use the Infobox widget. The colored box readily draws users’ attention to the content presented in it.

To add a wide image to catch the reader's attention, use the Hero Image widget. You can also add a headline, subheading, or the button widget on the image itself. The widget ensures that the image looks good on both devices, by letting you select the area of the image that needs to be visible on the smaller mobile devices.

To add accordion menus, use the Accordion widget. Accordion menus are stacked headers which, when clicked, reveal content under each heading. This is extremely useful for pages with lengthy content that benefits from a structured presentation. Users get a clear overview of the page and can click the expandable accordion header to read the content within it.

To add a button, use the Button widget. You can link a website, email address, or phone number to the button. When a user clicks on the button widget, the associated function is triggered. This assists users in taking prompt actions. For example, you have paired an email address with a button. When a user clicks on it, the email client installed on the user’s device opens to compose an email to the given address.

To add a center stage to present your news on your pages, use the News Stage widget. You can choose from different layouts and transition styles for the sliders. You can play the video directly from the News Stage. You can define the number of posts to be included in the slider. In addition, you also have the option to include teaser text and social interactions, such as comments, likes, bookmarks, and sharing.

To add the Staffbase newsfeed to your pages, use the News Feed widget. The page or section of the page acts like a news segment, which lists posts from a news page or a channel. You can define the number of posts to be included in the newsfeed. Users can see the latest or most interacted-with news posts in the feed depending on the predefined sorting setting of the news page or channel.

To add a list of useful website links, use the Link List widget. For example, on a page, you can add relevant links, such as links to picture and video galleries from the past activities, activities planned for the next year, and so on.

To add links, which are presented to the users in a tile format, use the Link Tiles widget. When a user clicks on a tile, the link associated with it opens. In addition, you can customize the layout by adding icons and modifying the background color.

The Portfolio Widget is ideal for linking different branches of similar content, such as different departments, locations, product lines, and more. Contextualize links for your users and make navigation even more intuitive by adding an image or short teaser to each linked item of the Portfolio widget.

To post content directly to a newsfeed, use the Post widget. The Post widget displays as an input field that users can click on to create posts quickly and intuitively. In the mobile app, you also have the option to configure the input field as a button that floats at the edge of the screen and allows your users to add new content no matter where they are on the page. The Post widget is particularly useful on pages with a high level of interaction, such as social walls, FAQ pages, or marketplace pages.

To embed plugin content to a page use the Plugin widget. Enhance your pages with plugin content, such as, forms, meal plans, calendar on events, and so on. You can even enable user interactions. This allows your users to submit forms or scroll through the week’s cantine options without navigating away from the page.

To add celebratory animations to your news posts that add a playful and engaging touch to your news posts, use the Animation widget. Enhance your posts with confetti, fireworks, balloons, or snow, and share the joy of good news or exciting announcements with your employees in a special way.

To allow users to join or leave an open group directly on a page, use the Group Subscription widget. This makes open groups more visible and accessible for your users. The widget recognizes if a user is already a member of the associated group, and appears accordingly. If a user is not a member, they can click the widget button to subscribe to immediately see content from that group. If users are already subscribed to a group, they can unsubscribe to leave the group and hide the content. Additionally, you can customize the button text and color.

To display external websites seamlessly on pages, use the Embedded Pages widget. This lets you strategically show an external website within a page, giving you the opportunity to bring multiple external content streams together in one area. You can customize the height to display optimally on desktop and mobile and enable scrolling and interactions to allow users to navigate and click through the external website without leaving the page.
Lets you invoke a function with an HTTP request.
The key attribute used to index imported contacts - this defaults to the email address, but can be changed to any other attribute that is unique to each contact
The way the Employee Email web app tracks unique vs. repeat opens and clicks
Based on existing support articles, "user management" references an activity but no specific part of the UI.
Amongst other uses: The end-to-end process of designing and sending emails

The Chat plugin allows private one-on-one or group messaging within the app. The chat is not only a great way to encourage casual communication between coworkers but also a valuable tool for users to attain detailed information quickly and directly.
A dialog in the chat. Can be one on one or in a group.

Use "Clear All/Alle entfernen" when removing all selections in the dropdown of a filter. This is opposed to "reset/zurücksetzen" when you set one or more filters outside of the dropdown back to default.
Usually used in the context of the number of clicks in a metric.

Use for telling users to select something. Note that may not apply to mobile instances where users “tap”; can be replaced with “select”; For commands, we omit the "on". [email] The first time a link in an email is clicked, just like with Opens, it will generate a Unique Click. If recipients click those links again, this will generate Repeat Clicks.
[button label] Use to remove an error message or modal.
A group of files in File Manager.

User reactions to news post and other content. See also "Reply". A user can leave multiple comments and comments to comments for the same news post. All comments are counted for metrics, also comments to comments.

AI writing aid for the StudioThe Staffbase Companion Editor supports content creators to create impactful news articles using generative AI capabilities. The Companion Editor can generate, adjust, and refine news content based on a small amount of contributor input.
AI search aid for employee app. Aka. "Intranet Chatbot"
For refering to the customers company/organization. Don't use "company".
For telling a user to fill in missing required fields.
For referring to the user's PC or device, e.g., "upload from computer".
[button label] Used in Comment Moderation project as a button label when user has to decide between removing a comment or moving it to trash.

Page element that opens when you configure a widget/plugin. Also know as "modal dialog", "confirmation dialog", or use any function such as "edit" for "edit dialog." A  dialog box is a small window that appears on a screen where you can input text or select a command.
To establish communications between two or more systems or devices. Used in Staffbase Connect; Microsoft Connections; Screens; Button label.
A descriptive text of an image. Can be displayed in fullscreen mode of an image. Not to be confused with Alt text.
Comment: Will be used for videos and PDFs, so just call it "Beschriftung" in DE?

Definition: Linking to Microsoft 365, ServiceNow, Google, etc.
News post, articles, and other information created, published, or saved. [navigation tab] Studio - contains content types like News and Posts; Channels.
a term to refer generally to any of the roles in the Staffbase platform able to create content (plugin, pages, news, etc)
Refers to all kinds of editors, for instance: Microsoft 365 Viva Communities widget, pages, Journeys, etc.

Language in which content using News, Pages, and plugins is created by editors;  Language that is preferred by the user; The language of the content created in News, Pages, and plugins such as Forms, Chat, and more, is called content language. In addition, the main menu is also affected by the content language.
Describes various content categories: email, article, news post, etc.
In Journeys, can add, update, or delete Journey steps. User content-specific role for adding content to a specific channel (also known as "author").

aka. channel author is a role explicitly designed to contribute to a single channel. This role is perfect for interactive channels in which you want many users to participate and interact—but without the ability to access or change the setup of the channel.
A dialog in the chat. Can be one on one or in a group.
Used for the user funnel metric and shows how many users 'convert' from one phase to the next.
To create a duplicate; use instead of "duplicate"; users are probably most familiar with this from "copy/paste"

Contrast with "Choose" - "create" should be for something the user thinks up and doens't choose from a list in the UI; contrast withh "Add"; button/action labels inlcude "Create Campgin/Link/Post/Survey" When a user takes an action to bring into existence something that wasn't there before, like creating a user group - contrast with "Generate"
Common Settings [field name]. For DE 'Erstellt von' is preferred as it is gender inclusive.
Something that only a particular customer uses or is not part of the standard Staffbase package of tools and technology. Can refer to integrations, fonts, icons, and other aspects of tools.
Custom icons let you add an individual touch to menu items in your Staffbase platform, such as news pages, static pages, folders, and plugins.
Custom widgets are web components that allow you to add specific types of content blocks to News or Pages on the Staffbase platform.
Comment: Should be changed in DE to "eigenes/benutzerdefinierts Widget"

Definition: Used for custom-built HR systems/integration that can be adapted to the Staffbase platform.
Feature to give the app an individual style, including branding
For changing the settings of a page, form, etc. to give it an individual style.
Overview of the tool for measuring engagement and content success. [nav tab label] Studio
Physical hosting infrastructure for apps and other online tools; site for data processing consisting of servers in a given location.

To put a device, mechanism (toggle, etc.) or system out of action. Used with "deactivated users", "deactivate account" - these users or accounts aren't removed or deleted from the system, but rendered dormant or not active.
Comment: We don't use 'enable' anymore to avoid ableist language.

Definition: Users who are not allowed to access the app, unless their access is granted again. Note that they have not been deleted. Deactivating can be a temporary status in case an employee is on leave, etc.
A time limit in the form of a date on or before which something must be completed. Used in planning, for instance for Stories or Briefings.

When linking to a sub-page within a system, a type of link that send users directly to an app instead of a website or a store. They are used to send users straight to specific in-app locations, saving users the time
A preselected option, a pre-designed value, or setting when no alternative, value, or setting is not specified by the user.

The default language is used for app content that is not available in the language of the user profile. By providing content in the default language, you ensure that users see the app content in an alternative language of your choice.
Original settings that have not been modified.

Use this when content is being purged and cannot be recovered again. If data that exists is being permanently lost, use “delete” instead of “remove” or “move to trash”. Note the DE "entfernen" = EN "remove"

Non-mobile app; stationary workstation or device; generally presents a larger UI display; note that  some functionality is limited to desktop only; sets up the difference between users who are typically in an office environment or location that allows for a stationary computer. Also called "Computer" in German.
Content created for deskop devices.
Any device that uses the desktop view as opposed to the mobile view, e.g. PCs and laptops.
User that use the desktop version of our products on a desktop device (PC, laptops, et.) as opposed to the mobile version on an mobile device (cell phone, tablet, etc.).
The version of our products that is used on a desktop device (PC, laptop, etc.) as opposed to the mobile version.
When talking about the different supported devices, e.g. mobile and desktop; can include other types in some cases

Page element that opens when you configure a widget/plugin. Also know as "modal dialog", "confirmation dialog", or use any function such as "edit" for "edit dialog." A  dialog box is a small window that appears on a screen where you can input text or select a command.
Refers to a setting that is or can be deactivated and thus also be enabled, e.g. API tokens, toggles, notifcations, etc. For users use "deactivated" instead.
For disconnecting Staffbase Connect; Microsoft Connections; Button label. For Screens use "trennen" as translation for "to unlink".
Connecting a Slideshow to a device in Screens (Digital Signage).

Use “display” instead of “show” when talking about the interface making a change. If the user triggers the action, use “show”. For example, a button could say “Show more”, but if there were help text about a setting it might say “Results are displayed in this column.”

Suggest developing a definition of "draft" to mean anything still in progress, not uploaded or published. Once a post is published and then unpublished, it should not revert back to "draft", but to "unpublished". This will normalize the status between both pages and posts.
Mostly used for file upload or for organizing menu items. DE Example: "Wählen Sie unter "Feld hinzufügen" das gewünschte Feld aus und ziehen Sie es per Drag-and-Drop in den Editor."
a menu where users can click to open and select from a list of options. Do not hyphenate ‘dropdown’ or refer to it without “menu” at the end.
To make changes to something the user has already entered, created or added.

Channel editor edits, publishes, and unpublishes others' posts. Can create own posts and can access channel set up and make certain changes to the channel settings. Also refers to someone in charge of the "editorial calendar."
Refers to different kinds of content editors.

[feature name] The Editorial Calendar gives editors an at-a-glance view of planned content in the spaces and channels they have access to. This makes it easy for editors to visualize content and see if too much content is planned for specific days. Content can then be redistributed to maximize reach.
"Employee Email" is preferred. Also, "Email Designer" are feature names. [navigation tab] Studio - contains all email functions.
A unique identifier of the form user "name@domain name" specifying a virtual location to which e-mail can be sent.

Allows transforming content from app or intranet into tailored newsletters, emails, or Slack messages. Editors can choose from a plethora of engaging templates and simply drag and drop news posts from the Staffbase platform directly where they want them.

[widget/plugin name] Embedded Pages widget/plugin lets you embed an external webpage or content from another part of your app directly on a page. This has the advantage that you can bundle related topics and important external content clearly on one central page.

Use in certain cases; with “employee app”; “Employee Email”; generally we say user in the Studio to talk about the customer’s employees or other people who are the end users and consumers of the content created, when related to permissions, roles, and so forth. Note, however, that not all organizations that use our products have “employees” - they may have “members,” “volunteers,” and so forth. Note: Came up in compiling word list for content guidelines for design system. Current SB style guide indicates to use "employees", not "users." However, not every organization that's an SB customer has "employees". Suggest keeping "user" as acceptable term for the end user of a customer - for example, a DHL driver or desk worker. Also covers non-employee end users.

Employee Email helps you create beautiful employee emails, distribute them to your own customized employee lists, and measure engagement so you can improve your internal communications strategy and make a measurable impact.
View presented to users who are viewing the information created in Studio and sent via app and internet. Often refers to a preview in Studio.

IN CSV file imports. Refers to a device that connects and communicates back forth to a computer network. As a first step to automate the CSV import, your IT team needs to upload your CSV file to the Staffbase environment using the Staffbase endpoint. Then, they can map your CSV file attributes to the Studio fields and update scripts using the Staffbase endpoint. Once your IT team tests the script, they can configure the script to run on a schedule that meets your business needs.

[analytics] An engaged user is a user who has commented, liked, or shared a news post at least once during a selected date range. At this time, users engaging in other App interactions, such as using the chat or other plugins, are not counted towards the number of engaged users. See "active users".

[posts] Feedback shows how users are reading and reacting can be called "engagement". See "engaged user". [email] How often users open the email, click on a link in the email, or return to do these things again. Can be indicated in measureable statistics.
Used as a verb to tell a user to input data, values, or information.
Refers to browser; also, an atmosphere in general, like "safe environment for comments"; can also mean within an app or product: "Microsoft Teams environment; Staffbase environment."
Used when adding News Central to a SharePoint page; button label in SP - when clicked, takes users to sign in and then to News Central in an SP page.
To ectract selected data in a specified file format (CSV, PDF, HTML) for downloading.
Content that is posted to other platforms (like social media) and not to Staffbase products.
[posts] Filter option to include content outside the Staffbase app, via linking or embedding. Can be ready-to-use or custom integrations.
The CK editor is the default editor of many Communications Control objects: Tasks, Ideas, Topics, Content (for self-defined content types without auto-publishing feature), and Stories.
Used to refer to requests for maintenance requests in buildings or other physical structures; refers to Forms Plugin or Staddbase Connector for Power Automate.
Refers to the main image in an article (channel type)
Field or email that contains content; can also refer to video.
When images or videos occupy enough screen space so that no content is cut off and other screen content is still visible

[feature name] With the Forms plugin, you can create customized forms for users to fill out and submit via the employee app. You can customize the contents, input types, and required fields to create a form that fits your needs perfectly.
When images or videos occupy the whole screen; some of the content may be cut off.

Inspired by a "Sales funnel" that shows the process prospects go through to become a customer. Each step of the funnel takes the buyer one step closer to making a purchase. Used in "User funnel" and potentially other analytics.
One of the stages a user goes through in a Funnel (e.g. User funnel) till they have fully progressed.
Use when the system or software provides a value automatically, like recovery codes, URLs, API token values.
The official name for the Google/Android app store. Do not use “Google app store” or other variants.
A group administrator has rights to add and remove group members and adjust group settings. A group administrator is focused on users, not content.
Chat conversation with more than 2 users.
Used in the comment moderation feature to conceal potentially inappropriate comments
Two words; for instructions or telling what the user sees when they put the cursor over an element.
Some text or a graphic in an electronic document that can be activated to display another document or trigger an action.

Graphical representation of a bigger concept (a pictogram or ideogram), a quickly comprehensible symbol of a software tool, function, or a data file, accessible on the system and is more like a traffic sign than a detailed illustration of the actual entity it represents. Usually focuses on one aspect, creates association.
Iframe is used to display other web content as independent documents in a defined area of the browser.

Prefer “image” to picture. “Image” covers a broader spectrum of digital images and icons. Includes “feature image” - main image in an article or post. Note the use of "avatar" for the image in the user profile
An electronic folder to which all messages are delivered. There is one for emails and one for chats.

[button label] Installation (or setup) of a computer program (including device drivers, plugins, widgets and apps), is the act of making the program ready for execution. "Uninstall" is to remove the program.

Don't use. Always say why or how something is invalid to avoid frustrating users. For field validation errors, say how to get the field to validate, like “The date must be in format MM/DD/YYYY.” instead of just “The date is invalid.”
A representation of Journeys for employees. Accessible via top navigation, it shows all journeys and their progress. Before, employees could only access Journeys via notifications.

[feature name] Mostly used for onboarding new employees. Journeys allows you to guide employees on their individual journey at your organization. Create customized content and set an individual timeline to support employees with their new tasks. Journeys are ideal for welcoming new employees to your organization, helping existing employees settle into a new user group, and much more.
[post statistics] column header - Date and time when most recent changes were made.
Used for emails, posts, widgets, and other elements. The manner in which different things are set out or arranged. This can include pictures texts, sections, and so on.
[link] Should only be used for linking to Support docs. Ideally, the phrase is embedded in a phrase like "Learn more about Twilio SMS character limits and guidelines."
[button label] Used when a user navigates away from the page that they are on. Seen in confirmation modals, as a user can lose data not saved when they leave the page.

Refers to users and the stages in the tools, depending on their status as employees or members of an organization: pending, onboarding, removal, and so on. Should be 2 words as a noun. "Life-cycle" as an adjective.
Comment: Only used in SP so far.

Definition: Chat reaction, see "reaction" and "chat". Can be counted as number of Likes.
Chat reaction, see "reaction" and "chat". The action of liking a post for instance.

Use "link." A link where the URL is not visible, the link can be embedded to text or an image. For customer and user-facing content; don’t use “weblink”; use URL for more technical audiences or to describe the web address, as the URL resides behind the link. (noun)
To supply someone with a hyperlink that directs to a different source.
For Screens, we use "link" (DE "verbinden") for connecting a device with a slideshow.
To prevent someone from editing, accessing or using something. For instance a cell phone can be "locked" or files can be "locked.
To handle or control files, channels, user, etc.

Managing editors have full rights to manage system-wide news channels and news posts in the platform. Managing Editors can add new channels, which is the right that distinguishes this role from the system-wide editor.
Image or video with a short caption that can be added to a post.
A post consisting of images or video with a short caption that can be previewed in dashboard tiles.
Comment: Doesn't appear in the UI so far.

Definition: A list from which the user may select an operation to be performed.
The main menu of the mobile Android app.
Electronic information paked in a "post" and sent via chat or email.

Plugin or widget that makes content or services from Microsoft platforms available in the app. Always make sure to use the full trademarked name. Do not use “MS 365”, “MS365”, “Office 365”, “O365”, or any other abbreviations not approved by Microsoft.
Microsofts proprietary  web browser.
Microsoft's corporate video-sharing service that replaced the existing Office 365 Video.

Microsoft Teams is a team collaboration application developed by Microsoft as part of the Microsoft 365 family of products, offering workspace chat and video conferencing, file storage, and proprietary and third-party application integration. Can be integrated into the Staffbase platform.

Use "mobile" when referring to the version of the app that is specifically build for mobile devices. Use "mobile app" instead of native app because "native" is ambiguous and also politically not correct. "Mobile menu" is the main menu of the mobile app.
The mobile version of our app as opposed to the Studio.
Use in place of "cell phone" - can also inlcude watches and tablets.
The main menu of the mobile app. Use "mobile" when referring to the version of the app that is specifically build for mobile devices.
Use when content is transferred to a new space, but not if data is being changed or deleted.
[field label] Use for anything that is not written yet can still have a designation, such as a user group, slide show, or app.
User is supposed to click on a part of the admin interface on a higher structural level e.g. 'news', 'pages', 'settings'.
Comment: Should we consider a less technical word? "Go to"/"leave"?

Definition: This metric displays the overall user sentiment for all the news posts assigned to the campaign, based on comments. A visual indicator shows where the current score lies in the -100 to +100 range. The score is calculated based on the percentage of positive comments minus the percentage of negative comments.

A channel is like a news segment in a newspaper or, in this case, the news page. Channels allow very fine, granular visibility settings as to who is allowed to see the posts within a specific channel in the app. See "post/news post", as channels allow for specific types of posts. They're based on both theme and post-type.
Interface for News and Pages/plug-ins- all the text and system messages that are displayed on the app
Content created in News for channels.
A listing of all the latest posts in the app. As newer posts are published, older posts move to the bottom of the newsfeed and gradually disappear from the newsfeed.
[button label] Use as the preferred button label for moving through a series of steps or process.

Use instead of “my” - “Your Files,” ‘Contact your CSM”. Avoid in error messages when possible. In German we use offer informal (du) and formal (Sie) for end-user facing content while only formal German for studio content.

Channels are, for example, social media accounts (such as an Instagram profile), destination addresses or URLs (such as a blog), or other publishing platforms to be connected via an API, where the content is published.

The channel administrator can select channel owners for content and for dialog. To be a channel administrator, the user needs the following access permissions: Write permissions for channel administration, Read permissions of team settings and Administration permissions of content publications.
Channel approval is necessary if at least one channel responsible has been entered for a channel. Without their approval, no content can be published on the corresponding channel.
Channel managers are responsible for individual channels. The channel manager can assign responsibles for content and dialog approvals (for the respective channel).
A central location for all files, images and videos. Thanks to a freely definable folder structure, you will find all assets sorted and structured.

Entity permissions can be created for content, topics, and media and only allow access to explicitly selected roles, groups, and users. They can be added as a separate module in Communications Control.
The event module contains all events that are relevant for your editorial planning. Events or occasions are often happenings. Content can be created for an event.

External users do not have full access to Communications Control. Content can be shared with them. Content cannot be edited in the external view. However, external users have the possibility to comment on it and be included in approval processes.
Goals refer to strategic objectives that you are pursuing with your communications efforts. Goals can be stored in the respective strategy area when creating ideas, content, topics & assets.
Ideas are a preliminary stage to final content. Unlike content, ideas do not yet have a publication date and do not appear in the calendar. An idea can become a content or a topic.

The ability to make changes to objects in table views without having to open them in the detail view. Note: The inline editing option is indicated by a pencil that appears when hovering over the fields.
This module contains all external content to which you have subscribed to RSS feeds in advance. An inspiration can be turned into an idea or content with one click.

In Communications Control you can define placeholders to insert in posts. While you work with the title in Communications Control, the 'value' appears later on the social networks. So the value can be, for example, a recurring greeting or something similar.

This field can be found in ideas, content, topics and events. It identifies the people who are responsible for an object. These do not necessarily have to be those who create the object (see "assigned to"), but rather are those who oversee its creation. For example, in the example of a blog article, the responsibility would be with the Head of Marketing, but the assignment would be with the Content Creator.
With the help of the shared library topics, individual content, ideas or assets can be made available to other teams. They can add the shared items to their own editorial calendars with one click.
A story is a kind of container to which several individual pieces of content can be assigned. The story serves as an overarching briefing to get everybody involved.

In the team settings, you can store various strategic components, such as topic categories, goals, target groups, tags and much more. All information stored here can be assigned in the respective strategy tab during later content creation.

In Communications Control, content, topics, topic categories, ideas, tasks, tickets, and media can be tagged during creation/editing for better discoverability. In comparison to hashtags, which are used externally, tags are the internal equivalent.
The topics module allows for planning and organizing projects with a longer duration. Ideas, stories, content, events or media can be assigned to a topic.
You have the possibility to create a multi-level topic structure in Communications Control (meta topic categories topic categories sub topic categories).
People or groups of people who are to be reached with the measures.
Abbreviation of “Open Authorization”. This abbreviation can be used, but only for technical audiences. Use sparingly.
A private conversation between two users in the Chat.
[label] Tells that a survey, for example, is only available in one unique instance. See also "Recurring"
For unlabeled icons that let users know to navigate to a another function to do a certain task. Use instead of "Go to".

[email] An open is triggered when a recipient loads your email and views the body of the message. The first time an email is opened by a specific recipient, it will trigger a Unique Open. Unique open rate is based on unique opens of the emails sent during the selected time frame
When users have various choices for performing actions or making a selection.

[Plugin] Pages make information permanently accessible. Pages are ideal for static content, which has lasting relevance or only requires minor updates from time to time. Some examples are: Information about the company, Contacts for different departments, Directions, site plans, Safety regulations.
[surveys] Used as "Survey Participant" - User who submits a survey.
A pending user is a user who has been invited to the App, but has not yet registered in the App.
Used in employee-facing screens and content; avoid "users," which we can use in Studio content for admins and editor
For the user management, users can get specific access rights assigned by the role they have.
Authorisation to use a file or make a connection with an external platform.
[navigation tab] Studio - contains Edtorial Calendar and Campaigns

The whole 'product' we give to a customer: from the app (web & native) to the admin interface, including APIs .. term to cover all of our solutions to refer to in the support forum INCLUDING the admin interface

Features that can be added to our platform from the Plugin Marketplace. Do not use a hyphenated “plug-in” or write it as two words “plug in”. Always write plugin as a lowercase word unless it is in a title or other element that uses title case.
The user interface of a specific plugin. Usually mentioned in connction with the language used in a plugin.

Content created in News for channels; generally more formal communications, such as write-ups, stories, features, reviews, reports, or analyses; Posts fall into three types (also called channel types): articles (text, images, and other media), media (picture or video with a short caption), and updates (short text with an option for media).
Social media posts in External content.
The action of posting content to social media in External content.

[post statistics] The maximum number of users who can potentially view a news post. For example, if a news channel has 100 subscribers, the potential reach for news posts in this channel is 100. This will includs users who have subscribed to an open group with access to the news channel.
To set up or configure a software system or hardware device with standard settings before selling or implementing it.

Language that is preferred by the user; The language of the content created in News, Pages, and plugins such as Forms, Chat, and more, is called content language. In addition, the main menu is also affected by the content language.
A setting that has been configured beforehand or is set as default.
Referring to a setting that has been configured beforehand or is set as default.
Use for instructions regarding keystrokes on the keyboard. See AI project: "To use AI Companion, press / ."

Preview should be used to indicate to content creators that they are seeing something in the end-user view. “Preview” alone should only be used before the content is available to users. If they have to publish content before they can see how their changes will look, use “live preview”.
A menu where users can manage the settings of their profile. Don't use “profile picture”, “profile settings”
AI: the text a user enters to generate results in the AI Companion.
Comment: Consider changing to "Prompt" in German if the term is establishing itself.

Definition: Used as a sidebar header in News pages; also in Surveys?
Making content like pages, posts, channels, surveys, etc. visible to your target audience.
Describes why user would create the content within the Stories feature.
Notifications alert you when a new chat is available in the employee app. You can activate and deactivate push notifications for your mobile or web app.
Context menu for quick access, accessible on mobile e.g. via swiping. Also for quick access from the Dashboard.

[Plugin] The Quiz Calendar is a fun way for your company to engage users leading up to significant company events, milestones, or the holidays. You can set up custom quiz questions, images, or text that your users can unlock each day of the calendar.

[news posts; post statistics] Consists of visitors and potential reach. The ratio of potential visitors to actual visitors for a news post. If a news post has a potential reach of 80 visitors, but only 40 users viewed the post, the reach is 50%.

How users can indicate their feelings about a post: Like, Celebrate, Support, Insightful, Thanks. A user can only react once to a news post and only choose one reaction. For example, if a user reacts with Support, this is counted as 1 Support reaction.
Turning a deactivated user account back to active. Also used for Employee Email.
The people who receive emails sent out using Employee Email.
use instead of “regular”; to show that something repeats at a specific interval.

Mostly for reloading web pages. Use "Neu laden" when you want a user to refresh the entire webpage, e.g. in an error message. Use "Aktualisieren" when it's about updating data within the app to the newest state.
AI: command to have AI generate results again

Use when talking about the Event Registration plugin or first-time registration in the app. Don't use interchangeably with “sign in”. Means to create an account in the app. A registered user is a user who has created a user account on your App or Intranet.
User who has created a user account in the App or Intranet.
Regular update of the product and its features.
Removing an item usually suggests that it is being taken out from its current view or location but may still exist elsewhere in the app. This action is often reversible.
When recipients click links in an email again, this generates Repeat Clicks as opposed to a unique click.
[email] Opens of an email on the same device are marked as Repeat Opens.
The answers to a comment in a thread.
A written answer/reaction to an email, post, comment, etc.

[button label] action that users can take to let channel moderation know about potentially hamrful comments. Comment reports are anonymously to protect the reporter's identity. Reported comments include: A colored bar on the side Red bar: Reported comments- action required; Blue bar: Comment hidden for moderation- action required.
Changing the scheduled time of an event in the Editorial Calendar.
[button label] For reset password - see user management
Answering to a survey.
Can be a "reply", but mostly used in Comments - can be posting simply an emoji
Comment: What's the difference between "Reply" and "Response"? Support results for "response": https://support.staffbase.com/hc/en-us/search?query=response&hPP=20&idx=zendesk_staffbase-support_articles&p=0&fR%5Blocale.locale%5D%5B0%5D=en-us&utf8=%E2%9C%93&is_v=1
new. Maybe also Ausschöpfungsquote, Anwortrate, Anwortquote

Definition: [button label] Used in page creation, reverts page or draft back to previous version. Can also refer to comments.
Use as "Show Results" or "Get Results"
Return Rate tab (in Studio Dashboard) ranks posts based on how many visitors opened the post more than once.
Taking away user's rights to do something.
[button label] Save Question/Settings. Used when user has made changes or edited something.
Planning of content release at a later point in time.
Label for planned content that will be released at a later point in time.
The unlocked screen of a mobile device that can still display certain information and alllow limited interaction.
Software or app that helps visually impaired people to navigate a website, web app or mobile app by reading out the screen elements that the person has selected.
For when we provide users with a range of option to pick from.
For written instruction where we ask users to pick something not necessarily predefined like a channel name.

Use this when broadcasting a message meant to be consumed by others (for example, news or chat messages). In cases where information is being sent for evaluation to someone else (such as Forms or Surveys) use “submit”.
Comment: For German use "versenden" instead of "verschicken". Simply for consistency reasons.

Definition: The number that is displayed to the recipients of an sms as the sender.
Employee Email: The status that displays in the Editorial Calendar on emails that have been sent using Employee Email

A user can share a post multiple times and every share is counted. For example, if a user shares one post once on Facebook, and twice via email, this is counted as 3 shares. German ist the past participle.
A user can share a post multiple times and every share is counted. For example, if a user shares one post once on Facebook, and twice via email, this is counted as 3 shares.
Use "display" instead when possible; If the user triggers the action, use “show”.
main menu of a native iOS app
Entering a user account by using the combination of a user's identification and password.

Exiting a user account. Use sign out, NOT log out when talking about exiting the app. Hyphenate “sign-in/sign-out” only if it is being used as a noun or adjective. [filter type] Registered Users  - "Sign-in Type"
The process of signing out.
Used to omit a specified number of posts in the Newsfeed widget.
A sequence of images shown one after the other. Mostly used in Screens to display news in an office lounge or at an event.

[field label] "Common Settings"; also Spaces are designated areas in the Studio to organize and manage content that needs to be made available to specific users. Spaces are similar to departments of your organization, headed by the respective department heads and in this case, headed by the space administrators.
A space administrator has space-wide administration rights for content management.
[use? context?]
Name for all Staffbase AI features. Each feature has a name consisting of “Companion” + function, e.g.,“Companion Editor” (Writing aid in the studio), “Companion Search” (intranet chatbot).
A computer system in which out studio and app is deployed and executed.
Comment: How is this different from the Staffbase platform?

Definition: Our software system that is used to provide our services.
Comment: How is this different from the Staffbase environment?

Definition: It is the admin interface where they can manage and customize their Staffbase app. It allows them to create and edit content, design the app's layout, manage users and permissions, and more. It is formerly know as "Experience Studio".
Comment: The Experience Studio uses an article in full sentences (like this one). Always use the full term the first time referring to it and if it is referenced again in the same text, you can abbreviate it to Studio. Do not use an acronym.

Definition: The "title" of a Story in Campaigns that sets the theme for the story.
Use “submit” in cases where data or content needs to be evaluated or approved by others, such as forms or surveys.
Used to refer to media formats that can be used on our platform, like jpg, avi or gif or to specific file sizes.
[surveys] Used as "Total survey rounds" - Each time the survey is published, it counts as one round.
The name for the survey plugin. In the interface, always refer to the feature as “surveys” and avoid pricing names like “Employee Surveys” or “Premium Surveys”, since these can change frequently.

System-wide editors have far more rights than normal editors and can access and facilitate system-wide news channels and news posts in the platform. System-wide editors cannot add new channels—as Managing Editors can.

A navigational widget, resembling a physical tab, for switching between documents or sets of controls. Part of the interface that is accessibly by clicking on an always visible "handle", clicking on that handle opens a new view with fields, options, ...

Use this when talking about reaching a specific group of users with notifications or content with a campaign or reach goal in mind. Content “visibility” describes rather anyone with access to the content, but “target audience” the subset of users who content creators are actively trying to reach.
Short paragraph to draw attention to an article post.
An icon that opens an action menu. Mostly used for mobile apps.
Appears in "Common Settings" of many plugins. Use for written comminications, such as a post, article, quiz calendar, form, meal plan, page, file, legal document, and so forth. Contrast with "name."
Used to describe the action of switching on a toggle in the interface.
A tile on the dashboard that displays the top post by Reach, Engagement and Return Rate.
The first time a link in an email is clicked, just like with Opens, it will generate a Unique Click.
[email] The first time an email is opened by a specific recipient, it will trigger a Unique Open
To completely remove hardware or software from a computer system.
ou can configure to automatically unpublish a post at a predefined date and time, before you publish it. Once a post is published, the function to unpublish the post is available.
To remove (something previously published) from circulation, so that is no longer visible to users.
Comment: There is also "Veröffentlichung zurückziehen" in German legacy, but use "Zurückziehen" going forward.

Definition: A user who does not have an account in the App or Intranet. Unregistered users are only able to access content in the public area.
New drafts emails, stories, newsletters, etc. are called by default "untitled" until they are given a name.
A modification of something to a more recent, up-to-date version.
[button label] To edit, change, or make current. For example, "Update Schedule"; as a noun, can mean latest changes or the making current of an app to its latest version.
To transfer data to our Staffbase platform. For media uploads use directions like “Upload image” instead of “Click here to upload image”.
Use URL for more technical audiences or to refer to the specific address behind the link. Use link in most instances for customer and user-facing content.
"Verwenden" emphasizes the process of use or application without particular emphasis on the resulting benefit.
"Nutzen" emphasizes the advantage or gain resulting from the use of something.

Avoid if possible, especially outside of the Studio. We still need to use “user” when referring to permissions and roles, but calling customers and their employees “users” or “end-users” can be impersonal and makes it sound like we think of them as objects, not people. What you use will depend on the context, but prefer “employees”, “participants” (for surveys, events, etc.), “others” (for example, “others in this channel”), or just “people
[title] Indicates number of active and engaged users

User groups allow to cluster users with similarities, such as users in the same office location, department, or with similar interests, and target content that specifically caters to these similarities. This can be done in a number of ways with different types of user groups. There are Internal, Conditional, Open and Mandatory groups.
The act of signing up as a user for the Studio/App.
A configurable section within the application that allows users to customize and manage their individual preferences and account details.
The name of a user regardless of their registration status (registered, deactivated, pending, etc.).
Used whenever a user has to enter text in captial letters.
Used whenever a user has to enter text in captial letters.
Used whenever a user has to enter text in small letters.
Used whenever a user has to enter text in small letters.
Analysis of the overall mood in the post comments. Using NLP, it attempts to detect whether comments are positive, negative or neutral, so that creator can take action accordingly.

Only use for very technical audiences. Otherwise prefer simpler words like “verify” or “confirm”. For field validation errors, always say how to get the field to validate, never say “Date is invalid.” (For example, say, “Date must be in format MM/DD/YYYY.”)
Used to invite users to see something in more detail or see a preview for instance.
[field label] Essentially determines which users can see the content in the chat, plugin, etc.

The number of visits measures the number of times the post, page, or other content type was been viewed or accessed. For example, if one user views an article 3 separate times, 3 visits are counted. If the number of visitors is less than the number of visits, it means that some users have visited the content multiple times.
Unique users who have visited a news post, page, or other content types. For example, if a user visits an article four separate times, this will only be counted as 1 visitor.
Can be used to directly call a user from their user profile. It is like a regular phone call without video.

A voice messages that can be send via chat. They can be recorded and sent from the mobile app. Voice messages can be up to two minutes long. Users can listen to voice messages in both the mobile and web app.
The browser version of our app. Not to be confused with the Studio.
A Website is a collection of web pages and related content that is identified by a common domain name and published on at least one web server.
A webpage is a document on the Web that is accessed in a web browser.[1] A website typically consists of many web pages linked together under a common domain name.

Widgets are like design elements that show particular content on any page or in news. Some widgets show static content, whereas others draw dynamic information, like news. Never use widget outside of the Studio, since employees unfamiliar with the page and news editors may not know they are using widgets.
Sender Name is who the email is from. It shows in the "From" section of the email message. Only one sender name can be selected at a time.

A recovery code enables users to reset their password and recover their user account. They can reset it by clicking the link "Forgot password?". Then, they enter their email address and a recovery code is sent. They follow the link in the email or enter the recovery code directly in the app. They create a new password.
Social media accounts that are used to publish external content to the corresponding platforms.

Refers to the top nav element that allows user to see numbers about the all aspects that we can capture for various categories. For example, when user clicks Analytics > Content, they see numbers for all different types of content within all the various spaces.
Refers to data about one particular content type, such as posts. For data of a single post, see Metrics.
Refers to specific, individual statistic types. For example, Visitors is a metric, Total Visits is a metric, and so forth.
Refers to the caption below an image, video or PDF file. This is available in the new Content designer.
Comment: This used to be only available for Images, which is why it was called "Bildunterschrift" in German.

Definition: The action of changing a previously chosen name. Often used as action menu item.
Proper name of our company. Always capatalize. Can be compounded.

The Launchpad functions in a similar way to the Launcher on a smartphone. It is a place where you can add apps to all the websites, tools, and apps your users access regularly. It is available in the top nav bar of the employee app for quick access.

The SAML Integrations plugin allows editors to link and embed sign-in-protected external content or services. If you have a SAML SSO solution in place, the Staffbase platform can use this to make sign-in-protected external content or services accessible to app users without an additional sign-in.
With the Netigate plugin, your users can access and submit surveys directly in the employee app via weblink.
SMS feature that allows customers to integrate a Twilio account into the Studio to send out SMS to specific employees.
Platform that allows sending SMS and is integrated in Staffbase's SMS feature

Hashtags are a way of tagging content with relevant words or phrases. Everyone can use hashtags in comments, and those with the correct permissions can also use them inside content, such as news posts and pages. They are available on the web app and on mobile versions 4.8 and higher.
In Branding, you can create Styles instead of setting up fonts, colors, etc. for every use and save them. Adjusting a style affects every place where it’s used.
Branding specifically for email. Admins can customize colors, default fonts, and links for emails.
Quick blocks in a content editor are pre-designed, reusable components that allow users to easily insert complex elements or functions, like image/text columns, rating stars, social media links, etc.
A modification of something to a more recent, up-to-date version.
An edit to an existing file.
Metrics on a specific videos, like total/unique and viewing time.

Staffbase offers various possibilities to infuse organization’s brand identity into their employee app. Companies can customize logos, icons, welcome page, text and background colors, etc. to customize the app to look like a proprietary product.
An input field that must be filled out or completed by the user before they can successfully submit a form or move on to the next step in a process.
An element in a user interface that allows users to enter data. They are fundamental components forms and other interactive interfaces where user data is required.

Conditional user groups are a special type of internal user group. A user cannot subscribe to or unsubscribe from a conditional user group. The management of conditional groups can be automated by tagging users to groups using CSV syncs or User API. This is ideal for large organizations, where personnel changes occur frequently.
A record of the address of a file or page, serving as a shortcut to it. For instance, news posts can be bookmarked to read them later.
Label in user managment that shows the user's mail addresses (professional and private) and identifier if available.

Users can be invited to the app via an email address when there is not enough data to onboard via username and password. Then access codes could be your last resort. A single unique access code allows a user to sign in once. During signup, users create a username and password, which afterwards are used to sign in.

You can set an identifier for each of your users. The identifier acts as a unique external ID. This can be used to identify your user in an external system and is very useful when using Staffbase API in conjunction with other systems or integration scenarios.
The Alignment is the result of an Alignment survey and shows how much employees support a campaign.

Alignment Surveys provide direct qualitative feedback from your employees about your campaign narratives. Using an alignment survey on your campaign-related news content allows you to track the impact your communication has on employees. You can clearly show stakeholders how your strategic narrative resonates with readers. With Alignment Surveys, you can learn how employees feel about the campaign message and if it changes over the course of a campaign.

Screens is our digital signage feature and allows customers to show slideshows, news post, images, etc. on screens across the company (lounge, elevator, etc.) or at events. If the QR code is enabled, people can scan it and read the rest of the post on the customer's platform, considering they have the rights to do so (Content in the public area can also be seen by outsiders).
Used in Screens to see and manage all connected and disconnected devices.
A code displayed after opening {yourapp}.staffbase.com/screens on a device for Screens. The code needs to be entered in Device managment to connect the device to it and allow slideshows to be shown.

All updates and notifications that users would receive via push or email notification, with the exception of chat notifications, appear in the Notification Center in the top nav bar of the employee app. There they can manually manage read and unread notifications at any time. They will receive updates in the notification center in the following cases: Posts published with a push or email notification (including surveys and journey steps), Comments to posts you have published, Direct replies to your comments

Part of strategic planning: Create a story to provide strategic guidance on your content. Define the subject, purpose, and audience for your content. You can create a record that's available to stakeholders and link the content.
